title: [$250] Add a "Track Distance" option in the "Add Expense" menu

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

body:
When there is an empty report the user sees an`Add expense` button/option in: - The workspace chat - Reports primary action button - Report secondary action menu when there’s an expense added - And soon in the report empty state - being worked on https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues/64730: We need to incorporate Manual distance creation into this flow by doing the following: - Add the `Track Distance` option to the menu and have it trigger the distance creation flow as outlined [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/18oJEJDDjA0-CUMofFewwjCaGv98cFetCrnk70ANNM-0/edit?tab=t.0#bookmark=id.1ya3yr7159zx) for the Manual and Map tabs. - Update the `Create expense` flow so that the create modal no longer displays the `Distance` option - as detailed [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/18oJEJDDjA0-CUMofFewwjCaGv98cFetCrnk70ANNM-0/edit?tab=t.0#bookmark=id.le2221p7wiyn).

title: [$250] Reduce test console errors

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
slack context: https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C08CZDJFJ77/p1758194196572189 ### Proposal Initial effort to reduce test console errors and improve development workflow, with a batching approach for future cleanup. ### Background Our test suite currently produces 8,559 console errors across 186 test files, mostly React act() warnings. While all tests pass, the cluttered output makes it hard to identify legitimate issues during development. ### Problem When developers run tests to validate their changes, the overwhelming volume of console errors (8,559 errors) obscures real issues, which prevents us from quickly identifying legitimate bugs and reduces developer confidence in our testing feedback. ### Solution 1. Wrap Onyx operations in act() calls. 2. Fix navigation initialization warnings. 3. Improve async handling in tests. These changes reduce errors from 8,559 → ~3,167 (63% reduction). We intentionally stop here to avoid excessive mocking that could weaken test reliability. #### Next Steps We propose a batch-audit approach where related test files are grouped and fixed together. This keeps PRs small enough to review, but avoids overwhelming maintainers with too many submissions. We can provide a list of affected files, and contributors can pick up batches to continue the cleanup. This way, the community can collaborate on reducing noise without creating unnecessary review overhead.

title: [CRN-QA] Report field formulas: Report name is not updated to “Report field value {field:Test text}” and app crash observed

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
**Issue Reported by** : Applause Internal Team


**Expected Result:**
Report name updated to Report field value {field:Test text}

**Actual Result:**
Report not updated and displayed as Report field value updated. App crash observed when deleting the report field and navigating to the workspace chat


**Actions Performed:**
Testing account configured for "Custom report formula" by running the snippets


1. Go to the workspace settings > Report
2. Enable report fields (if needed)
3. Add a report field
4. Set the name to “Test text”, type Text, initial value to “initial”
5. Save the field
6. Select the “Default report title”
7. Enter “Report field value {field:Test text}” and save it
8. Open the expense report
9. Verify the report name is “Report field value initial”
10. Set the report field to “updated”
11. Verify the report name is updated to “Report field value updated”
12. Set the report field to “{field:Test text}”

And more steps, see the video


https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/64e7dfec-1f75-472e-92ae-1bbab24580e6

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @DylanDylann</details>

If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** 9.2.15-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from TestRail:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-825/folder/13176706/41236840/899329345 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** sdjoinsjidosjois@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Device used:** Mac 15.5 / Chrome **App Component:** Workspace Settings ## Action Performed: 1. Go to staging.new.expensify.com 2. Go to workspace settings > Company cards. 3. Add two card feeds 4. Click Add Card > United States > Commerical feed > click on one of the options > enter random numbers (ex. '1'), Next > Submit. 5. Click on the card feed > click Add Card to add the second feed. 6. Go to Overview > Plan type. 7. Click Collect. 8. Click Downgrade workspace. 10. Click "keep only one card feed" link. BUG 1: Company card page is blanked out briefly. 12. Click on one of the feeds > Settings > Remove card feed 10. Go to Overview > Plan type. 11. Click Collect. 12. Click Save. 13. Click Downgrade workspace. 14. Click Got it, thanks. 15. Go to Company cards. BUG 2: Downgrade workspace RHP appears briefly when navigating to Company cards. ## Expected Result: BUG 1: Company card page will not blank out after clicking "keep only one card feed" link. BUG 2: Downgrade workspace RHP will not appear when navigating to Company cards. ## Actual Result: BUG 1: Company card page is blanked out briefly after clicking "keep only one card feed" link. BUG 2: Downgrade workspace RHP appears briefly when navigating to Company cards. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [x] MacOS: Desktop ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/13c201fe-ad3d-46b4-a053-57faf3b66d6f [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
## Background Related (internal) issue where this was discussed: https://github.com/Expensify/Expensify/issues/545698 ## Details We'd like to update this screen on **web/desktop ONLY**: ## Updates [(Figma)](https://www.figma.com/design/h9Qd3CtNMtDo9ucblrUQbR/Text-receipts-to-47777-Promo-Banner?node-id=52-3553&p=f&t=f3q2QsTzU1YNvee0-11) The screen should be dynamic for these four scenarios: 1. No mobile app downloaded or phone number added 2. Mobile app downloaded, but no phone number added 3. No mobile app downloaded, but phone number added 4. Mobile app downloaded and phone number added ## Notes - `Download the app` should link to: https://new.expensify.com/settings/about/app-download-links - `Add your number` should link to: https://new.expensify.com/settings/profile/contact-methods cc @Expensify/design @davidcardoza
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @parasharrajat
